intro: Astragalus schimperi var. subsessilis, commonly known as the Ethiopian milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant has pinnately compound leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. This species is of interest for its potential ecological and medicinal properties.
